newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Airlines gets US$72 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: China Airlines gets US$72 mln loan.

text.p: Taiwan's China Airlines has agreed to obtain a 12-year syndicated loan worth US$72 million to finance aircraft purchases, a lead underwriter said on Thursday.
An executive at the International Commercial Bank of China said by telephone that the bank and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce would be the loan's lead underwriters.
The interest rate was capped at SIBOR plus 0.415 percentage point, the executive said.
China Airlines would sign the contract with the banks in October.
In May, China Airlines signed contracts to buy eight Boeing 747-400 planes at a total cost of $1.4 billion.
In December 1995 it purchased six Boeing 737-800 planes with options to buy a further nine in a deal worth $750 million.
